answers.answer: Honkai Impact 3rd is better for players who prefer fast-paced combat and diverse gameplay mechanics.
reason: Honkai Impact 3rd offers a variety of gameplay modes, including aerial combat and experimental stage designs (index 12).
The game features a wider selection of weapons compared to Genshin Impact, such as cannons, scythes, and katanas (index 22).
Honkai Impact 3rd emphasizes fast-paced, action-packed battles with jaw-dropping special effects (index 22).

answers.answer: Genshin Impact is better for players who enjoy open-world exploration and a more casual gaming experience.
reason: Genshin Impact features an open-world map with exploration, loot, and secret locations, unlike Honkai Impact 3rd's episodic arenas (index 22).
The game provides a more accessible experience for free-to-play players, with less reliance on specific gear and more flexibility in character builds (index 10).
Genshin Impact's open-world design and elemental reaction system cater to players who value exploration and strategic combat (index 22).

answers.answer: The choice between Genshin Impact and Honkai Impact 3rd depends on personal preferences and playstyle.
reason: Honkai Impact 3rd is more competitive and rewards strategic planning, while Genshin Impact is more forgiving for casual players (index 11).
Both games excel in different areas: Honkai Impact 3rd focuses on fast-paced combat, while Genshin Impact emphasizes exploration and world-building (index 12).
The decision ultimately depends on whether players prioritize combat complexity or open-world exploration (index 12).

prompt.content:
You are given:
- A question
- A set of webpage contents, each with a corresponding index
- A target number of clusters (clustering number)

# Task
Your task is to process the webpage contents and organize them into the required number of clusters based on their answers to the question.

# Rule
Each cluster should contain:
1. A single core "answer" that represents the main viewpoint of the group.
2. A list of "index" values representing the webpages that support this answer.
3. A list of "reason" entries explaining why this answer is supported. Each reason should be a concise, specific point.

# Instructions:
- You must create exactly 3 clusters, no more, no fewer.
- You must include all index in your clusters, do not miss anyone.
- Each answer should be distinct and represent a unique viewpoint.
- Supporting Reasons must be grounded in the content of the webpages. Do not invent information that is not present in the original content.
- Be concise and factual. Avoid redundant or overly generic answers and reasons.
- If a webpage content supports multiple reasons under the same answer, include all relevant reasons under the corresponding answer.
- Output must be a valid JSON object exactly as specified. Do not include any additional text, comments, or explanations outside the JSON.
- Clusters must form a non-overlapping partition of all indexes: each index must appear in one and only one cluster.

# Example
Output strictly in the following JSON format:
```json
{
  "answers": [
    {
      "answer": "The core answer representing one cluster.",
      "index": [1, 3],
      "reason": ["Supporting reason 1", "Supporting reason 2"]
    },
    {
      "answer": "The core answer representing another cluster.",
      "index": [2],
      "reason": ["Supporting reason 3", "Supporting reason 4"]
    }
    // Continue until 3 clusters are completed
  ]
}

# Attention
- The numeric contents of the index arrays in different answers must not overlap. Each index should appear in exactly one index list.(such as "index": 1, 3 in [1, 3] and 2 in index [2] are mutually exclusive)
- Each reason must be clearly supported by content from the corresponding webpage(s). Do not fabricate or generalize beyond what is explicitly stated.
- The entire output must be a valid JSON object that follows the given format strictlyâ€”no additional comments, metadata, or text.
- Ensure that the total set of indexes across all clusters forms a complete partition: every original index is included and none are duplicated.

## Question
Which one is better? Genshin Impact or Honkai Impact 3rd?

Comparing them is like trying to compare Final Fantasy RPGs vs Final Fantasy Tactics...  
Or, Dragon Slayers series vs Heroes of Legend series vs Trails series  
Honkai Impact 3rd is part of the main Honkai Project family, being just one of the multiple Honkai games. Genshin Impact is a spin-off of the Honkai series.  
  
Honkai Impact is more like a Visual Novel merged with a brawler (beat 'em up) game. Imagine playing .hack, DMC, Tekken or Persona with short fighting stages in between and long long dialog cutscenes. With story/character design/settings copy-cat from Evagelion, Touhou and Blazblue. There's also a bunch of game genres (Shooting, Platformer, Sports, Board Game, etc) added to the game as mini games and events. So consider this a huge experiment ground for miHoYo as well as a jack of all trades in game genre wise. On the bright side, it's pretty hard to get bored with all those "experimental" new stuffs in each update.  
  
Genshin Impact is known as a "degraded" copy-cat version of Zelda: BOTW. You can consider it as an Open world Action RPG. They are not even on the same genre with HI3rd eventhough HI3rd do have some "Stand-Alone" Open world RPGs added to some of its chapters/arc/side events, HI3rd is still basically a "brawler" game and GI's "ARPG" like Zelda. Well... "like" is probably not accurate here, because [they copy a lot of BOTW mechanism down to the core in a 100% cloning](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ooAfSSn5V4). Although GI started with a boo-boo being called "The Bad clone of Zelda" or "Zelda's Rip-Off", but over the years GI have added enough(?) contents to keep the game interesting. But still, it can only rival BOTW if we take away all the ridiculous RNG and Gambling stuffs (eg Gacha) from the game.  
  
As for contents, Genshin is newer, and the update speed is slow. While on the other hand HI3rd is old with new contents and events added every 2 week and a version update every 45 days. So you can easily tell that Genshin will have better engine and graphic due to it's newer, but HI3rd has far more contents due to its age and update speed.  
  
The new Honkai Star Rail is the newest series to the Honkai series, but weirdly they didn't give it a numbering in the Original Chinese version (eg, HG1, HG2, HI3), hinting that it may still be a spin-off of HI3rd itself. Kinda like Trails and LoH series or Megami Tensei and Persona series. And yes, these games are made in China by miHoYo, a company in Shanghai.  
  
If you are looking for a new adventure to start and wanted to play an anime themed Online MMO game... then my advise is probably, be a bit patient and wait for the up coming "Blue Protocol" from Japan. Where originality wins over copy cats. Especially if you like the anime themed "Ni no Kuni" game series which originally got their designs and ideas from the famous anime studio Ghibli.

Everything you do in Genshin is in the third person and is unable to be changed. In Honkai, theyâ€™re free to make as diverse a game mode they want (as long as the character are the same as in-game). Last update we had a game mode close to PvZ and now we have fall guys. Events story wise: reiterating my statement from earlier, Genshin is forced to stay stuck to the travellerâ€™s storyline. No event can come back the same way after each release. Plus crucial story plots for certain characters motivations are locked to these specific events. Honkai, on the other hand, can use any character it wants to make a story because of the multiverse. Plus there is a literal completely separate storyline spanning several events that are re-running with their only changes being rewards. I hope you like my endless rambling essay comparing two games made by the same company. ~ sincerely a traveller and a captain.

How Much F2P Friendly Honkai Impact Compared to Genshin Impact?
===============================================================

 [![Image 6](https://upload-os-bbs.hoyolab.com/upload/2024/04/24/ee4ce490bf9293b29cb1d06f87283636_4056140685590506263.png?x-oss-process=image%2Fresize%2Cs_600%2Fauto-orient%2C0%2Finterlace%2C1%2Fformat%2Cwebp%2Fquality%2Cq_70) ![Image 7](https://upload-os-bbs.hoyolab.com/upload/2024/11/18/b987067ac8ba04090d8bb933dbce329f_4757121441238711439.webp?x-oss-process=image/auto-orient,0/interlace,1/format,webp/quality,q_70)](https://www.hoyolab.com/accountCenter?id=30923235)

[Lavenioufa ![Image 8](https://hyl-static-res-prod.hoyolab.com/upload/static-resource/2022/02/23/03185fd4de1a2eca54e98bddfd104262_8699433121737777339.webp) ![Image 9](https://fastcdn.hoyoverse.com/static-resource-v2/2023/11/20/117a51e8b5e00d18e982aa1c47a0986b_2366555044488039835.png)](https://www.hoyolab.com/accountCenter?id=30923235)  

2023/06/12

Follow

In Honkai Impact, you really canâ€™t do much once you past level 80 if you donâ€™t have their signature equipment, both their Stigmata and their Weapon.

Genshin Impact, at this point, does not require 5-star weapons to beat content or constellations. Your work is pulling the character, having a good 4-star weapon and grinding good artifacts. Itâ€™s far and away a more assessable F2P friendly game.

Story and events it's a cake walk, and you can still get crystals from Abyss and Memorial Arena without going tryhard, but if you're going competitive, then like any other gatcha games, there's Powercreep.

Honkai Impact on the other hand, the Abyss put players each other to see who can beat the boss faster and get a score, so the New Valkys always will be better than the oldest and you need to have your team updated. Of course that this only apply to the Red Lotus and Nirvana.

In terms of banners, Honkai Impact are "slightly" better than Genshin Impact because there are no 50/50 (in the context of getting S-tier Valky).

Also, Honkai Impact is less-friendly because you have to pull for the character AND the gear (Stigmata). Weapon pities do not carry over unlike Genshin Impact. Only the EXPA character banner in Honkai Impact has a pity that carries over.

![Image 10](https://hyl-static-res-prod.hoyolab.com/divider_config/PC/line_1.png)

**Summary**

*   **For casual players who just want to keep up with the story and events**, there is 0 incentive to spend money. It's entirely accessible for free with no difficulty spikes or gear checks.
*   **For completionists**, this game is a nightmare with the amount of time limited content. Not even a paycheck can save you.
*   **For competitive players**, biggest paycheck wins (with some strategic spending possible). That usually only applies to leaderboard based modes, which are completely optional.
*   **As a story driven player**, they only touch the gacha to get their favorites with no regard for meta, and the f2p income is sufficient for that.
*   **Pity** : Because of soft pity, pulling character in Genshin Impact mostly need about 70-ish. While on Honkai Impact, usually I need to reach hard pity (100th pull). That's true btw, I still remember exactly the moment I got Silver Wing Bronya. It took me 95 pulls in order to get her. Godness...
*   **Weapon** : On high level, Honkai Impact really needs Valky's signature weapon to be able to compete on the Memorial Arena or on the Abyss. On Genshin Impact, while it's good to have the signature weapon, you can use free weapons (forged weapons, Festering Desire, "The Catch", and any other limited-event weapons) or 4-star weapons (Favonius Weapon Series, The Flute, Stringless, etc.) and your character can still do massive damage. On top of that, weapon in Genshin Impact can be used by multiple character. Like Staff of Homa on Zhongli, Wolf's Gravestone on Razor, and Skyward Harp on Tartaglia.

### [@BNuts](https://m.youtube.com/@BNuts)

[2 years ago](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=yIO-fphe2fE&lc=UgyuhdnPXGNv2icAgMZ4AaABAg)

For me, HI3 takes the lead: the combat is more fluid and feels both flashier and more substantial, with each Valk having a variety of skills, and the sequence in their battlesuits showing their character development. Then you have the ability to forge workable (and even some top) weapons and stigmata if you can't get them in gacha. But even the gacha has fair guarantees via a more generous Pity count, as well as a full set of equipment having its own banner, with guarantees of getting all pieces. Some banners give fragments every 10 pulls, making it easier to rank Valks up and unlock further skills -- and the fact you can rank any unit up to make them more powerful is a big plus. As well as the ability to farm a lot of great SP units, many of which are considered top Support units and gamechanging. While a lot of effort goes into Genshin too, I feel like the Genshin team lets RNG determine way too much, and especially later on, that's going to be a big factor in how much players do or do not enjoy the game. Since it's impossible to get artifacts via the gacha, and the only way to get constellations (rank up) is the gacha, it's much harder for players to power up their units. The Genshin team did give players a way to exchange unwanted artifacts, but the cost to use this function, as well as the RNG, make it more worth it just to do more artifact runs. The overall greater randomness does not feel good, and has frustrated many people. The most demonstrative case of this is when Tectone originally went after the Staff of Homa. Back then, Pathing on the Weapons Banner was not a thing, so there were not any guarantees about which 5 star weapon a player would get. The Weapons Banner is still widely considered a scam, and unfriendly to Freeplayers and Limited Spenders, but back then, well... Tectone tried to get the Staff across multiple streams, since losing so many times hurt on an emotional and psychological level, even just to watch. In the end he spent $1,700 just to get a single Staff of Homa, and he still had to R5 it. Generally speaking, C6'ing a 5 star character is prohibitively expensive to Freeplayers and Limited Spenders, who would prefer to save their resources for new characters. It is satisfying to see big numbers while in combat, but there's a huge gap in general experience between Leviathans like Tectone who feel the game is too easy, and Freeplayers and Limited Spenders, who find Abyss to be challenging, sometimes just to complete, nevermind to 36 star. The latter group is left feeling undergeared because of RNG, and hoping PvP is never added to the game. Big spenders, meanwhile, are left bored and hoping for a challenge.

### [@raibyo](https://m.youtube.com/@raibyo)

[2 years ago (edited)](https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=yIO-fphe2fE&lc=Ugy_jsvT3HlKso6Bv2V4AaABAg)

I don't play Genshin much so I can only say for Honkai side. In Honkai, certain characters, especially main dps are very much set with their own equipment that mismatching equipments would only make them worse, while a lot of the support characters are made to be mismatched. Like how Pardofelis is an ice support bout some she end up being able to support other elements depending on the stigma and like how Divine Prayer can switch between physical and lightning support depending on the equipment. There's also the Fu Hua Margrave set which is good for pretty much all elemental supports. While the main dps are set with their equipment, once in a while, intentionally or unintentionally, the new equipment introduced end up being better than their old signatures, like how Eden's stigma is better for HoT than HoT's signature set Banaras, and like how Elysia's stigma set being useful for pretty much all physical dps valks, and like how Ana Schariac set is best for most Ice dps. And back a few years, Monet set was best lightning set and then they introduced Goemon set. mixing up those two sets actually ended up being better than set effects of both of the sets alone, so much that it ended up changing the game meta for a while. Even now Monet and Goemin mix is still the standard go to set for lightning dps if you don't have the signature set. There's also the fact that the two Fu Huas, HoS and AE will pretty much always be in meta, from what we have seen. You will see AE as a support on most elemental teams and HoS pretty much is the most essential physical support. Also, another thing Honkai have over Genshin is that because of the way the game and characters are structured, you get different versions of the same character in Honkai while you only get one version of each character in Genshin. I know a bunch of people who would die to get Raiden Shogun boss as a playable character but since there's already a playable Raiden Shogun, it is unlikely. Like, in Honkai, even if the character you liked in story ended up having a gameplay style you don't like, you can still expect a future version of that character which have a gameplay style that suits you more. Same can't be said for Genshin. But who knows. Time will tell. Maybe they'll end up adding a different version of the characters that already exists or a system similar to the augment system from Honkai. For me, the biggest thing Honkai have over Genshin would be not related to any of the stuff I mentioned above, but rather, a basic and essential control and gameplay element that makes a lot of difference, that is, not requiring to manually switch between Keyboard and controller. That's a big problem Genshin have. It's not that much of a problem for Mobile players since they don't have the problem in the first place and Play Station players should be used to that but it is a big problem for PC players. In Genshin, if you want to use the controller, you end up sacrificing the use of mouse which is stuck to Keyboard mode. Honkai on the other hand let you use both without needing to switch through. The mouse and the keyboard remains entirely functional while you're playing with the controller and switching only requires you to drop the controller and grab the mouse. If Genshin have the same function, a lot of stuff would be made a lot easier. Imagine if you're using a bow character while using the controller and you can simply just switch to mouse immediately when you want to aim. The main gameplay of Genshin is pretty much made for controller, but there are a lot of stuff the benefits from being able to use the mouse and keyboard and the problem is, we are stuck with choosing one or the other and not both. Maybe we should be able to persuade enough people in the playerbase to ask for it in future surveys? If enough people ask for it, they might just add it.
